_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:45 using v2.7
title: How does physician density per population compare internationally and how has it changed?
analysis_commentary:
Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) have estimated physician and nurse density (head count per 1,000 population) in several countries.

Physician density has increased since 1993 for all countries chosen for review from the OECD report (see "about this data" link for the selection process). In 1993 the United Kingdom had the lowest physician density of the 9 states with 1.7 physicians per 1,000 people. By 2013 it was 6th (of the 8 states that also had comparable data at that time) and 0.5 physicians per 1,000 population lower than the 2013 OECD average with 2.8 physicians per 1,000 people.
